WRITING.TITLE: No Food? Goodbye! I love her :-)
Wild Herb Salad With Baked Camembert
WRITING.TEXT:
**Ingredients**
* Prep Time 10 minutes * Cook Time 10 minutes * Total Time 20 minutes * Servings 2 * Ingredients * 2 ea Camembert * 4 oz wheat bulgur * 1 cucumber * 1 shallot * 1 lemon * wild herbs like 1 bunch of wild garlic, parsley, chives, sorrel, dandelion leaves, watercress, minze * basil * wild lingonberry jam * olive oil * salt * pepper
**Instructions**
1. Preheat the oven to 300F for the Camembert. 1. Heat up in a large pot 1 tbsp of olive oil and roast the bulgur about 1 - 2 minutes. 1. Then stir 1/2 cup of hot water, add a little bit salt and boil at the lowest level approx. 10 minutes. Take the pot from the stove and let it soak for about 5 minutes. 1. In the meantime rinse and drain the wild herbs. 1. Cut the cucumber in half (if you do not like the seeds remove them with a teaspoon), slice it and put it in a large bowl. 1. Now mix up the lemon juice for the vinaigrette with 3 tbsp of olive oil, salt and freshly grounded pepper. Peel leaves of basil, chop them and the shallot finely and add all to the bowl with cucumber. 1. Put the Camembert into the oven and bake it about 7 minutes. 1. Now loose up the Bulgur and put it also to the bowl. Mix well and give it some time to absorbe the full flavor of the vinaigrette. After a while add the herbs. 1. Now put the wild herbs salad on a plate, put the baked Camembert on top and add a tablespoon of the lingonberry jam.
[Recipe Source](http://www.oneinspirationperday.com/recipes/wild-herb-salad-bulgur-baked-camembert/)

WRITING.TITLE: Delicious Black Forest Style Tarte Flambe Recipe
WRITING.TEXT:
Tarte flambe is an Alsatian-Mosellan and South German dish composed of bread dough rolled out very thinly in the shape of a rectangle (traditionally) or circle, which is covered with fromage blanc or crme frache, thinly sliced onions and lardons. It is one of the most famous specialties of the region. (Wikipedia)
We will show you how to make the "Black Forest Tarte Flambe. You will love it!
[ Find the recipe with images here ](http://www.oneinspirationperday.com/recipes/delicious-black-forest-tarte-flambee/)
**Ingredients**
* 200 g flour * 2 tbsp olive oil * 125 ml water * 1 pinch salt * 200 g creme fraiche (or sour cream) * 200 g onions * 100 g bacon * 1/2 spring onion * A tiny bit chive
**Instructions**
1. Preheat the oven at max temperature. 1. Mix flour, oil, water and salt to make a dough (ready at the moment it isnt sticky anymore). Roll it out as thin as possible. 1. Spread the creme fraiche or sour creme on top of dough, then put the onions, spring onions and bacon on top of it. Season it with salt and pepper. 1. Put it into the oven and bake it for about 10-13 minutes. The moment it looks crispy it's done! Now you only have to spread the chive over it and voil your delicious black forest tarte flambee is ready!
[ Find the recipe with images here ](http://www.oneinspirationperday.com/recipes/delicious-black-forest-tarte-flambee/)
I am doing different variations of "Flammkuchen" (Tarte Flambe) today, shall i put together a recipe ? Maybe i can also create a video: never tried that before :-)

WRITING.TITLE: My cat earlier today

WRITING.TEXT:
Yes it absolutely is a regional thing. Well the best thing is, if available to take a more european style bread. Most of the times it isn't that sweet. Which i prefer. You can use toast for example (maybe thats what you mean with "sandwich bread? ) Sorry stupid german. i dont know all the expresions :-) Make sure the crumbs are reall fine.
The essential part to make the schnel look like that is to use enough fat! No matter if you are using oil or condensed butter. Ideally the Schnitzel doesn't touch the bottom of the pan.
The moment you see that the sides of the schnitzel get slightly colored you have to move the pan around so that the fat swashes over to the Schnitzel. Then wait a little and turn the Schnitzel. Then do the same thing with the other side. just repeat that a couple of times.
Another thing is to be careful when you dip the schnitzel into the breadcrumbs. Really just slightly press the meat into the crumbs. Ideally do not press at all. Just throw it in there and what sticks to it is enough. just so that everything is covered.
Another trick is to give a little bit of mineral water to the eggs. Just experiment with it. Cant wait for your feedback. You'll see it works.
Cheers

Regarding the potato salad....Traditionally its done without mayo. Its seasoned with vinegar and oil. No mayo, no eggs :-) At least in the bavarian / austrian region.
And the best way to cook it is to use a lot of concentrated butter. It has to swim in it :-) And then just move the pan around a couple of times so the butter is spilling over it. This way you will end up getting a beautiful wavy coating.

WRITING.TITLE: Make the perfect Wiener Schnitzel in 15 minutes
WRITING.TEXT:
[Recipe Source]( http://www.oneinspirationperday.com/recipes/the-perfect-original-wiener-schnitzel-done-15-minutes/) Wiener Schnitzel is a traditional austrian and german dish that tastes absolutely wonderful. You should absolutely try it yourself. There are two well known variations. The Original Wiener Schnitzel which is made from veal. And the Schnitzel Wiener Art which is made from pork.
Tip: You can easily replace veal cutlets with boneless pork chops. It is also very tasty and a common dish in Germany and Austria. So try it out! Try to use dried out french baguette for the bread crumbs. Its taste gets the closest to the german / austrian bread roles called Semmeln or Semmerl.
**In the Basket:**
* 1 1/2 pounds veal cutlets * 1/2 cup all-purpose flour * 2 eggs * 1 teaspoon minced parsley * 1/2 teaspoon salt * 1/4 teaspoon pepper * 1 pinch ground nutmeg * 2 tablespoons milk * 1 cup dry bread crumbs * 6 tablespoons butter * 4 slices lemon
**How to make it:**
1. Place the veal cutlets between two pieces of plastic wrap, and pound with the flat side of a meat mallet until about 1/4 inch thick. If you dont have a meat mallet you can also use a heavy pot to flatten it. It is best to do this one cutlet at a time. 1. Dip the cutlet into flour to coat it. Do not press to heavy. 1. In a medium bowl, stir together the eggs, parsley, salt, pepper, nutmeg and milk. 1. Place bread crumbs on a plate. Make it from old baguette if you want. The bread they use in Germany or Austria is very special. Baguette gets closest to it. 1. Dip each cutlet into the egg mixture and slightly press in the bread crumbs to coat. Not to much as we want the coating to be fluffy and not sticking to the meat once its cooked. 1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the breaded cutlets until each side is browned, about 3 minutes per side should be enough. While the meat is in the pan take a spoon and spill the hot butter over the it a couple of times.
Enjoy your original Wiener Schnitzel!
[Recipe Source]( http://www.oneinspirationperday.com/recipes/the-perfect-original-wiener-schnitzel-done-15-minutes/)
